title: Soil and water supervisor rallies against reliance on synthetic chemicals in public parks - Port City Daily
summary: A pilot project at Olsen Park is testing the efficiency of synthetic-free land care to phase out toxic herbicides and pesticides, with a focus on using green alternatives promoted by Soil and Water Conservation District supervisor Evan Folds. The project involves a joint effort by the city and county to implement organic land management practices, aiming to demonstrate the effectiveness of a synthetic-free program on two ballfields compared to traditional methods on three fields.
green_innovation: TRUE. This initiative to test synthetic-free land care practices at Olsen Park aligns with the concept of green innovation by aiming to reduce negative environmental impacts associated with the use of toxic herbicides and pesticides.
business_innovation: FALSE. The focus of the article is primarily on environmental sustainability practices related to land care and pesticide use rather than on the introduction of new products or processes for business operations.
green_product: TRUE. The shift towards synthetic-free land care practices using green alternatives in the pilot project at Olsen Park corresponds to the definition of a green product as it involves the design and use of services to reduce environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE. The implementation of synthetic-free land care methods and organic land management practices described in the article align with the definition of a green process, as they aim to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability in operational activities.
product_or_process: Olsen Park synthetic-free land care pilot project
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 924120 - Administration of Conservation Programs, 561730 - Landscaping Services, 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services, 541320 - Landscape Architectural Services
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not suggest any false or misleading environmental claims or deceptive marketing tactics, but rather focuses on initiatives to promote genuine environmental sustainability practices.

title: Kohler Co. Outlines Strategy, Ambitions, and Progress in 2022 ESG Report - Contractor Magazine
summary: Kohler Co. released its 2022 ESG report outlining advancements in environmental sustainability, diversity and inclusion, and social impact initiatives, including reductions in GHG emissions, water, and waste intensity, diverse hiring practices, community engagement, and positive impacts on over 1 million lives in 2022.

title: Retail India News: Farmley Unveils ‘Healthy Ko Rakhe Healthy’ Campaign with Rahul Dravid - Indian Retailer
summary: Juicy Chemistry and Mommy Shots by Amrita unveil the 'Scars are Beautiful' campaign, celebrating motherhood and body positivity by showcasing the beauty of postpartum bodies and stretch marks. Through inspiring stories and powerful photos, the campaign aims to empower women to embrace their bodies and challenge societal norms.
